page.title: 15LIMERIGG VILLAGE LIFE
page.content: In a survey done by Limerigg Primary pupils,we found that the most common number of people occupying one house is 2. The largest number of people in any one house is 10. Most of the houses in the village are owned by Falkirk District Council and most of the tenants have always stayed in Limerigg. We found that shopping was mainly done in the neighbouring towns but the majority did use the mobile vans for bread,fish and butcher meat. Approximately one-third grow their own vegetables. The village shop is used occasionally by everyone but the regular customers tend to be pensioners. There is also a mobile library van which visits the village once a week and is used by nearly one-third of the villagers. Finally the survey proved that all but a very few really enjoyed staying in Limerigg
